queryParameters.name: API Key
queryParameters.description: API Key

endpoints.name: Listing metrics
endpoints.description: Returns a list of all the metrics in Klaviyo

endpoints.name: Listing the complete event timeline
endpoints.description: Returns a batched timeline of all events in your Klaviyo account.

queryParameters.name: Since
queryParameters.description: Either a Unix timestamp (UTC) to use as starting datetime, OR a UUID obtained from the next attribute of a prior API call. Defaults to current time.

queryParameters.name: Sort
queryParameters.description: string, 'asc' or 'desc', defaults to 'desc'Sort order to apply to timeline.

queryParameters.name: Count
queryParameters.description: integer, Number of events to return in a batch. Default = 50, Max = 100

endpoints.name: Listing the event timeline for a particular metric
endpoints.description: Returns a batched timeline for one specific type of metric.

pathParameters.name: Metric ID
pathParameters.description: Get Metric ID from Listing metrics

queryParameters.name: Since
queryParameters.description: Either a Unix timestamp (UTC) to use as starting datetime, OR a UUID obtained from the next attribute of a prior API call. Defaults to current time.

queryParameters.name: Sort
queryParameters.description: string, 'asc' or 'desc', defaults to 'desc'Sort order to apply to timeline.

queryParameters.name: Count
queryParameters.description: optional, integer, defaults to 100Number of events to return in a batch.

endpoints.name: Exporting metric data
endpoints.description: Export event data from Klaviyo, optionally filtering and segmented on available event properties.

pathParameters.name: Metric ID
pathParameters.description: Get Metric ID from Listing metrics

queryParameters.name: Start Date
queryParameters.description: Beginning of timeframe to pull event data for. The default value is 1 month ago.

queryParameters.name: End Date
queryParameters.description: End of timeframe to pull event data for. The default is the current day

queryParameters.name: Unit
queryParameters.description: Granularity to bucket data points into - one of ‘day’, ‘week’, or ‘month’. Defaults to ‘day’.

queryParameters.name: Measurement
queryParameters.description: Type of metric to fetch - one of ‘unique’, ‘count’, ‘value’, or ‘sum’. Defaults to ‘count’. For 'sum' a property name to operate on must be supplied as a JSON-encoded list like '["sum","ItemCount"]'

queryParameters.name: Where
queryParameters.description: JSON-encoded listConditions to use to filter the set of events. A max of 1 condition can be given. Where and by parameters cannot be specified at the same time.

queryParameters.name: By
queryParameters.description: The name of a property to segment the event data on. Where and by parameters cannot be specified at the same time.

queryParameters.name: Count
queryParameters.description: Maximum number of segments to return. The default value is 25.

endpoints.name: Retrieving a Person's Attributes
endpoints.description: Retrieve all the data attributes for a person, based on the Klaviyo Person ID.

endpoints.name: Listing a person's complete event timeline
endpoints.description: Returns a batched timeline of all events for a person.

queryParameters.name: Since
queryParameters.description: Either a Unix timestamp (UTC) to use as starting datetime, OR a UUID obtained from the next attribute of a prior API call. Defaults to current time.

queryParameters.name: Sort
queryParameters.description: string, 'asc' or 'desc', defaults to 'desc'Sort order to apply to timeline.

endpoints.name: Listing a person's event timeline for a particular metric
endpoints.description: Returns a person's batched timeline for one specific event type.

pathParameters.name: Metric ID
pathParameters.description: Get Metric ID from Listing metrics

queryParameters.name: Since
queryParameters.description: Either a Unix timestamp (UTC) to use as starting datetime, OR a UUID obtained from the next attribute of a prior API call. Defaults to current time.

queryParameters.name: Sort
queryParameters.description: string, 'asc' or 'desc', defaults to 'desc'Sort order to apply to timeline.

endpoints.name: Lists : Get Lists
endpoints.description: Get a listing of all of the lists in an account.

pathParameters.name: List ID
pathParameters.description: Get List ID from Get Lists

endpoints.name: List Subscriptions : Check List Subscriptions
endpoints.description: Check if profiles are on a list and not suppressed.

pathParameters.name: List ID
pathParameters.description: Get List ID from Get Lists

queryParameters.name: Emails
queryParameters.description:
list of emails
 The emails corresponding to the profiles that you would like to check.

endpoints.name: List Memberships : Check List Membership
endpoints.description: Check if one or more people are already members of the specified list, based on their e-mail addresses. No distinction is made between a person not being subscribed to the list, and not being present in Klaviyo at all.

pathParameters.name: List ID
pathParameters.description: Get List ID from Get Lists

queryParameters.name: Emails
queryParameters.description:
list of emails
 The emails corresponding to the profiles that you would like to check.

endpoints.name: List Exclusions : Get All Exclusions on a List
endpoints.description: Get all of the emails that have been excluded from a list along with the exclusion reason and exclusion time. This endpoint uses batching to return the records, so for a large list multiple calls will need to be made to get all of the records.

pathParameters.name: List ID
pathParameters.description: Get List ID from Get Lists

endpoints.name: Group Memberships : Get Group Member Emails
endpoints.description: Get all of the emails in a given list or segment. This endpoint uses batching to return the records, so for a large list or segment multiple calls will need to be made to get all of the records.

pathParameters.name: List ID
pathParameters.description: Get List ID from Get Lists

endpoints.name: Campaigns in Account
endpoints.description: Returns a list of all the campaigns you've created. The campaigns are returned in reverse sorted order by the time they were created.

endpoints.name: Campaign Information
endpoints.description: Summary information for the campaign specified that includes the name, ID, list, subject, from email address, from name, status and date created.

pathParameters.name: Campaign ID
pathParameters.description: Get Campaign ID from Campaigns in Account

endpoints.name: Campaign Recipient Information
endpoints.description: Summary information about email recipients for the campaign specified that includes each recipients email, customer ID, and status.

pathParameters.name: Campaign ID
pathParameters.description: Get Campaign ID from Campaigns in Account

queryParameters.name: Sort
queryParameters.description: Order results chronologically, in ascending or descending order. The possible values are asc or desc. Defaults to asc.

endpoints.name: List all templates
endpoints.description: Returns a list of all the email templates you've created. The templates are returned in sorted order by name.

endpoints.name: List Exclusions or Unsubscribes

queryParameters.name: Reason
queryParameters.description: Filter results based on the reason for someone being excluded. The possible values are unsubscribed, bounced, invalid_email, reported_spam and manually_excluded. Only a single value be specified at a time.

queryParameters.name: Sort
queryParameters.description: Order results chronologically, in ascending or descending order. The possible values are asc or desc. Defaults to asc.

endpoints.description: Get global exclusions or unsubscribes. Global exclusions are distinct from list exclusions in that these email addresses will not receive any emails from any list. Typically, when someone unsubscribes from a campaign, they are only unsubscribed from that list and are not globally unsubscribed.

operations.name: Adding or Updating a Person's Attributes
Lists : Create or Update a List
Exclude or Unsubscribe Someone from All Email
Render template
operations.description: Renders the specified template with the provided data and return HTML and text versions of the email.
